thread.title: Ga West Assembly again fails to elect Presiding Member
thread.title_full: Ga West Assembly again fails to elect Presiding Member

title: Ga West Assembly again fails to elect Presiding Member
text:
Politics | 23 October 2015 17:00 CET Ga West Assembly again fails to elect Presiding Member By GNA 
Amasaman (G/A), Oct. 23, GNA - Mrs Felicia Dapaah, the Coordinating Director of the Ga West Municipal Assembly, has said the failure to elect a Presiding Member (PM) would delay the development of communities in the area. 
She, therefore, urged the members of the Ga West Municipal Assembly to prepare for the third round of election for a PM. 
Mrs Dapaah gave the advice in an interview with the Ghana News Agency after the assembly members failed to elect a PM for the second time. 
The contestants are Madam Beatrice Agbelanyo, the incumbent assembly member for Deedeman, Mr Love Alister, assembly member-elect for Amasaman and Nii Klotey Boye II, Chief of Ofankor. 
Nana Oduro Numapau, the Municipal Electoral Officer for Ga West, announced the postponement of the election till further notice since none of the contestants could get the mandated two-thirds majority of the votes cast. 
GNA
